description: Organic chemistry is the study of compounds containing carbon, emphasizing the structures
and mechanisms of reaction of these molecules. This course focuses on structure,
nomenclature, and reactions of aliphatic and alicyclic compounds, including aspects of
stereochemistry and spectroscopic identification of organic compounds.  A full treatment
of introductory organic chemistry requires subsequent enrollment in CHEM 248.  Offered
Prerequisite: CHEM 126 or permission of instructor.
